ticket.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!
ticket.original-body:
Certain textarea inputs are improperly truncated before being placed in 'params', so that apps do not see the full text submitted.
How to reproduce:
* Unzip attached sample rails app (generated with "rails" script from 2.3.8) * script/server * Go to http://localhost:3000/things/new * Open the attached "Dizzy.rtf" file in TextEdit (I haven't been able to test this on non-Macs), select all, copy, and then paste into the textarea on the above page * Click save
Note the value of 'text' in the deliberately-thrown error: it contains just the final paragraph of the text, where it should contain the full text.
In Rails 2.3.5, all the text is placed in 'params', even with the same Rack version.

In Rails 2.3.5, all the text is placed in 'params', even with the same Rack version.

version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body: Steve, can you reproduce it in Rails test suite? It makes much easier for us to investigate.
version.body-html: Steve, can you reproduce it in Rails test suite? It makes much easier for us to investigate.
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body: Okay, a patch providing a test case is attached, together with a dump of the original raw request (which came from Chrome on Mac, though the same problem is evident with Safari).
version.body-html: Okay, a patch providing a test case is attached, together with a dump of the original raw request (which came from Chrome on Mac, though the same problem is evident with Safari).
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body: The problem, incidentally, seems related to the url-encoded quote marks in the string.
version.body-html: The problem, incidentally, seems related to the url-encoded quote marks in the string.
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body:
previous version of rack used to remove quotes if there is no line break.
It was recently changed after much debate on rack mailing list. http://github.com/rack/rack/commit/dae12e088592ee69545b5f2f81b87f4959859164
version.body-html:
previous version of rack used to remove quotes if there is no line break.

It was recently changed after much debate on rack mailing list. http://github.com/rack/rack/commit/dae12e088592ee69545b5f2f81b87f49...
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body:
Re: the Rack changes -- wow, I'm amazed there was any debate; it seems like removing parts of the submitted text would obviously be a bad idea.
But is this a Rack issue? Does the code covered by this patched test ask the Rack stack to parse the URL-encoded params? Or is this parsing Rails-specific? It would be odd to test Rack in a Rails test.
And if so, I have a question: submitting the sample text to the same test app running under Rails 2.3.5 on the same machine did not cause the problem. Does this mean the two Rails versions were picking up different Rack gems (I have 1.2.1, 1.1.0 and 1.0.1 installed)? And if the problem was an *old* Rack gem, why would the newer Rails version (2.3.8) show this problem?
version.body-html:
Re: the Rack changes -- wow, I'm amazed there was any debate; it seems like removing parts of the submitted text would obviously be a bad idea.

But is this a Rack issue? Does the code covered by this patched test ask the Rack stack to parse the URL-encoded params? Or is this parsing Rails-specific? It would be odd to test Rack in a Rails test.

And if so, I have a question: submitting the sample text to the same test app running under Rails 2.3.5 on the same machine did not cause the problem. Does this mean the two Rails versions were picking up different Rack gems (I have 1.2.1, 1.1.0 and 1.0.1 installed)? And if the problem was an old Rack gem, why would the newer Rails version (2.3.8) show this problem?
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body:
I did not notice that it was 2.3.x issue. I am not sure if rails 2.3.8 uses rack for parsing params.
There was another ticket regarding rails edge in which text area having "hello world" will have quotes removed. However "hello \n world" would have quotes preserved. That issue got fixed by that rack commit.
version.body-html:
I did not notice that it was 2.3.x issue. I am not sure if rails 2.3.8 uses rack for parsing params.

There was another ticket regarding rails edge in which text area having "hello world" will have quotes removed. However "hello \n world" would have quotes preserved. That issue got fixed by that rack commit.
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body:
Rails 2.3.8 indeed appears to require the broken Rack version 1.1.0, whereas 2.3.5 required Rack 1.0.1, so I guess we can assume that this regression is due to the new dependency on a broken Rack.
That's a pity.
version.body-html:
Rails 2.3.8 indeed appears to require the broken Rack version 1.1.0, whereas 2.3.5 required Rack 1.0.1, so I guess we can assume that this regression is due to the new dependency on a broken Rack.

That's a pity.
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body: I am not sure if rails 2.3.9 will use the upgraded version of Rack. If it does then this problem will be solved.
version.body-html: I am not sure if rails 2.3.9 will use the upgraded version of Rack. If it does then this problem will be solved.
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body: Yeah, I hope so -- as it stands, I've already decided that 2.3.8 isn't safe for production use, since certain user input will get silently truncated, and there's no workaround. Shame that Rails should be compromised by this silly Rack issue.
version.body-html: Yeah, I hope so -- as it stands, I've already decided that 2.3.8 isn't safe for production use, since certain user input will get silently truncated, and there's no workaround. Shame that Rails should be compromised by this silly Rack issue.
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body: Can we please get Rails 2.3.9 to use the fixed Rack version?
version.body-html: Can we please get Rails 2.3.9 to use the fixed Rack version?
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body: Pending patch and test.
version.body-html: Pending patch and test.
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body: +1 from me. Have to go back to 2.3.5 for my App now. Then quotes are submitted correctly.
version.body-html: +1 from me. Have to go back to 2.3.5 for my App now. Then quotes are submitted correctly.
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body:
Confirmed still present in 2.3.9.
I had a go at bumping the Rack version to 1.2.1, but a whole bunch of tests break then.
version.body-html:
Confirmed still present in 2.3.9.

I had a go at bumping the Rack version to 1.2.1, but a whole bunch of tests break then.
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body: I've been using the attached initializer to fix this issue with Rails 2.3.8 and 2.3.9. It replaces the parse_query and normalize_params methods in Rack::Utils with fixed versions (the code is from Rack 1.1.0 with the patch from http://github.com/rack/rack/commit/dae12e088592ee69545b5f2f81b87f4959859164 applied).
version.body-html: I've been using the attached initializer to fix this issue with Rails 2.3.8 and 2.3.9. It replaces the parse_query and normalize_params methods in Rack::Utils with fixed versions (the code is from Rack 1.1.0 with the patch from http://github.com/rack/rack/commit/dae12e088592ee69545b5f2f81b87f49... applied).
version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body: Terrific - thanks Phil.
version.body-html: Terrific - thanks Phil.

Nasty bug. Patch works well for me (Rails 2.3.10).
version.body-html:

version.title: Textarea input silently truncated in 2.3.8!

version.body:
For those who also ran into this bug: http://groups.google.com/group/rack-devel/browse_thread/thread/5876f28aac65f67c you may want to use the attached updated patch, which applies the following two commits:
http://github.com/rack/rack/commit/c028a23b36debbce1005347d4234fe6e32373223 http://github.com/rack/rack/commit/55cbbc91ae0a03445dd9e0ba1830f70fbd2f4d52
version.body-html:
For those who also ran into this bug: http://groups.google.com/group/rack-devel/browse_thread/thread/5876... you may want to use the attached updated patch, which applies the following two commits:

http://github.com/rack/rack/commit/c028a23b36debbce1005347d4234fe6e...
http://github.com/rack/rack/commit/55cbbc91ae0a03445dd9e0ba1830f70f...
